name: piquancy
content:
piquancy noun [U]
(INTEREST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
interest and excitement, especially because of being mysterious: What gives the debate extra piquancy is that the governor of the bank has been on opposite sides to his chief economist. He ended the relationship, which lends a certain piquancy to her new status as his boss.
More examplesFewer examplesThe problem of fuel smuggling has been given an added piquancy with the recent barricading of the refineries.This new movie lacks a certain piquancy.For Isobel, the presence of her mother actually added to the delicious piquancy of the situation.

piquancy noun [U]
(SPICE)
a pleasant sharp or spicy taste: Capers add piquancy to sauces. Pineapple and pear give this healthy salad a sweet accent, while balsamic vinegar adds a delightful piquancy. See
piquant
More examplesFewer examplesThe pork is studded with the occasional peppercorn for a pleasant piquancy.Pickled chillies add heat and piquancy.The piquancy of any pepper is due to capsaicin.
